intro: Pedicularis davidii var. pentodon, commonly known as the five-toothed lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often with distinctive five lobes on the corolla. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats and is adapted to cool, moist environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
